data:
1
00:00:15,473 --> 00:00:17,809
First, there was darkness.

2
00:00:19,352 --> 00:00:22,188
Then came the Strangers.

3
00:00:22,230 --> 00:00:25,025
They were a race
as old as time itself.

4
00:00:26,067 --> 00:00:28,737
They had mastered
the ultimate technology--

5
00:00:28,820 --> 00:00:34,075
the ability to alter
physical reality by will alone.

6
00:00:34,075 --> 00:00:36,745
They called this ability
"Tuning."

7
00:00:37,912 --> 00:00:39,748
But they were dying.

8
00:00:39,831 --> 00:00:42,876
Their civilization was
in decline,

9
00:00:42,876 --> 00:00:45,628
and so they abandoned
their world,

10
00:00:45,670 --> 00:00:48,340
seeking a cure
for their own mortality.

11
00:00:49,716 --> 00:00:53,178
Their endless journey brought
them to a small, blue world...

12
00:00:53,261 --> 00:00:55,347
in the farthest corner
of the galaxy.

13
00:00:56,389 --> 00:00:57,849
Our world.

14
00:00:58,892 --> 00:01:00,894
Here, they thought
they had finally found...

15
00:01:00,935 --> 00:01:02,896
what they had been
searching for.

16
00:01:13,740 --> 00:01:16,576
My name is
Dr. Daniel Poe Schreber.

17
00:01:17,577 --> 00:01:19,245
I am just a man.

18
00:01:19,287 --> 00:01:22,082
I help the Strangers
conduct their experiments.

19
00:01:23,625 --> 00:01:25,752
I have betrayed my own kind.

20
00:04:53,168 --> 00:04:55,003
You are confused, aren't you?

21
00:04:55,045 --> 00:04:57,839
Frightened. That's all right.
I can help you.

22
00:04:57,839 --> 00:04:59,507
-Who is this?
-I'm a doctor.

23
00:04:59,507 --> 00:05:02,218
You must listen to me.
You have lost your memory.

24
00:05:02,260 --> 00:05:04,387
There was an experiment.
Something went wrong.

25
00:05:04,429 --> 00:05:06,598
Your memory was erased.
Do you understand me?

26
00:05:06,681 --> 00:05:08,725
No, I don't understand.
What's going on here?

27
00:05:08,725 --> 00:05:11,561
There are people coming for you
as we speak.

28
00:05:11,561 --> 00:05:13,897
Don't let them find you.
Leave now.

29
00:05:15,106 --> 00:05:17,275
Hello? Are you there?

30
00:05:59,442 --> 00:06:01,945
Hey, Mr. Murdoch,
the Automat called.

31
00:06:01,945 --> 00:06:03,446
Said you left your wallet there.

32
00:06:04,489 --> 00:06:08,118
I suggest you retrieve it, since
you only paid for three weeks,

33
00:06:08,159 --> 00:06:09,953
and they was up 10 minutes ago.

34
00:06:11,996 --> 00:06:13,498
I've been here three weeks?

35
00:06:13,498 --> 00:06:16,668
It's right there
in black and white, Mr. Murdoch.

36
00:06:16,710 --> 00:06:19,170
Day and date.

37
00:06:19,170 --> 00:06:22,465
We make our books like we make
our beds, all neat and tidy.

38
00:06:22,465 --> 00:06:25,510
-I'll take care of it later.
-See that you do.

39
00:06:25,510 --> 00:06:27,679
Only thing makes you a guest
in this joint...

40
00:06:27,679 --> 00:06:29,097
is cash on the barrelhead!

41
00:06:46,990 --> 00:06:49,701
House rules.
Three weeks is three weeks.

42
00:06:49,743 --> 00:06:52,287
No days off for good behavior.

43
00:07:03,214 --> 00:07:06,843
Mr. Murdoch, yes?
Where is he?

44
00:07:06,885 --> 00:07:10,347
He just left
not five minutes ago.

45
00:07:11,723 --> 00:07:13,516
Sleep now.

46
00:07:16,061 --> 00:07:20,106
When the rumba rhythm
start to play

47
00:07:20,190 --> 00:07:22,359
Dance with me

48
00:07:22,400 --> 00:07:25,403
Make me sway

49
00:07:25,445 --> 00:07:29,407
Like a lazy ocean hugs the shore

50
00:07:29,449 --> 00:07:31,701
Hold me close

51
00:07:31,743 --> 00:07:34,579
Sway me more

52
00:07:34,579 --> 00:07:38,917
Like a flower bending
in the breeze

53
00:07:38,958 --> 00:07:41,378
Bend with me

54
00:07:41,419 --> 00:07:44,255
Sway with ease

55
00:07:44,297 --> 00:07:48,259
When we dance,
you have a way with me

56
00:07:48,301 --> 00:07:50,762
Stay with me

57
00:07:50,762 --> 00:07:53,348
Sway with me

58
00:07:54,140 --> 00:07:58,186
Hey, sweetie, he said he was
your husband's doctor.

59
00:07:58,228 --> 00:07:59,771
He wanted to speak with you.

60
00:08:20,000 --> 00:08:21,292
Excuse me.

61
00:08:23,211 --> 00:08:24,754
-Doctor...
-Schreber.

62
00:08:24,796 --> 00:08:28,800
Please, won't you come in?
You must be Emma Murdoch.

63
00:08:30,135 --> 00:08:33,596
Thank you for coming to see me
on such short notice.

64
00:08:33,638 --> 00:08:35,098
What is this?

65
00:08:35,140 --> 00:08:38,685
A rather crude experiment
designed to further my studies.

66
00:08:38,768 --> 00:08:42,439
I don't understand. You say
you're my husband's doctor,

67
00:08:42,480 --> 00:08:44,983
but he never
mentioned you to me.

68
00:08:45,025 --> 00:08:47,861
The truth is, John has been
coming to see me...

69
00:08:47,861 --> 00:08:49,362
for quite some time.

70
00:08:49,362 --> 00:08:52,699
He had been grappling
with feelings of betrayal...

71
00:08:52,782 --> 00:08:55,827
stemming from
your marital difficulties.

72
00:08:55,869 --> 00:08:57,787
-John told you what happened.
-Yes.

73
00:08:59,164 --> 00:09:01,458
When was the last time
that you saw him?

74
00:09:01,499 --> 00:09:04,377
Three weeks ago.
He packed a suitcase.

75
00:09:04,419 --> 00:09:06,921
He was very angry at me.

76
00:09:06,963 --> 00:09:09,799
I understand how difficult
this must be for you,

77
00:09:09,841 --> 00:09:11,176
but for John's sake,

78
00:09:11,217 --> 00:09:14,179
I would like you to think of me
as your friend, Emma.

79
00:09:14,220 --> 00:09:17,849
It appears that John
has suffered a psychotic break.

80
00:09:17,891 --> 00:09:21,019
-Complete memory loss.
-You can't be serious.

81
00:09:21,061 --> 00:09:24,022
Oh, but I am.
He may be delusional.

82
00:09:24,064 --> 00:09:25,357
Even violent.

83
00:09:26,691 --> 00:09:30,695
If he were to contact you,
you must call me immediately.

84
00:09:30,695 --> 00:09:33,198
Wherever your husband is,
he is searching...

85
00:09:34,908 --> 00:09:36,117
For himself.

86
00:09:46,294 --> 00:09:50,215
Good evening, Mr. Murdoch.
It is Mr. Murdoch, isn't it?

87
00:09:51,132 --> 00:09:54,594
Mr. "J" something Murdoch?

88
00:09:57,972 --> 00:10:02,143
J. Murdoch. What's your name?
Justin? Jerry?

89
00:10:06,481 --> 00:10:08,566
My name's Jason Murdoch.
John Murdoch.

90
00:10:08,608 --> 00:10:11,152
Jake Murdoch. How's it going?
Hi. Jack Murdoch.

91
00:10:17,534 --> 00:10:19,285
Got to get a grip on myself.

92
00:10:43,351 --> 00:10:46,771
I told the guy,
cash on the barrelhead.

93
00:10:46,771 --> 00:10:50,108
I said, "Listen,
three weeks is three weeks."

94
00:10:50,108 --> 00:10:53,695
-Where's our lucky winner?
-Upstairs, sir. Room 614.

95
00:10:54,988 --> 00:10:56,322
The call girl.

96
00:11:00,952 --> 00:11:03,830
-Evening, Husselbeck.
-Inspector Bumstead.

97
00:11:03,830 --> 00:11:05,623
Your lace is untied.

98
00:11:06,833 --> 00:11:08,126
Sorry.

99
00:11:16,551 --> 00:11:18,136
Am I glad you're here, sir.

100
00:11:18,178 --> 00:11:20,805
They say Detective Walenski's
got the heebie-jeebies.

101
00:11:20,847 --> 00:11:23,016
Just take what they give me,
Husselbeck.

102
00:11:53,922 --> 00:11:56,466
-Thanks a lot.
-Excuse me.

103
00:11:58,885 --> 00:12:00,720
-Hello?
-Oh, it's you.

104
00:12:01,429 --> 00:12:04,099
-You left your wallet here.
-When did I do that?

105
00:12:04,140 --> 00:12:06,393
-When you was last here.
-When was that?

106
00:12:06,434 --> 00:12:09,771
When you left your wallet.
Expect me to remember?

107
00:12:15,610 --> 00:12:18,405
-Excuse me!
-No, no, seriously.

108
00:12:35,755 --> 00:12:37,590
-Where you headed, chief?
-Home.

109
00:12:37,632 --> 00:12:38,925
And where's home?

110
00:12:38,967 --> 00:12:41,761
Haven't you mugs got
anything better to do?

111
00:12:41,803 --> 00:12:44,055
I'm just doing my job, May.

112
00:12:44,097 --> 00:12:46,141
There's a killer out there.

113
00:12:46,182 --> 00:12:48,852
Look for him
instead of cooling your heels.

114
00:12:52,147 --> 00:12:53,898
Go on. Get out of here.

115
00:13:02,824 --> 00:13:03,950
Come on.

116
00:13:07,162 --> 00:13:09,956
What's that make so far?
Six hookers in all?

117
00:13:09,956 --> 00:13:12,876
-I believe so, sir.
-Give the man an "A" for effort.

118
00:13:18,340 --> 00:13:20,633
So, Husselbeck,

119
00:13:20,675 --> 00:13:27,140
what kind of killer do you think
stops to save a dying fish?

120
00:13:27,182 --> 00:13:29,017
-Got me, sir.
-Bumstead.

121
00:13:29,059 --> 00:13:32,395
What took you? This killer's
been running circles around us,

122
00:13:32,395 --> 00:13:33,521
thanks to Walenski.

123
00:13:33,563 --> 00:13:35,357
With all due respect,
Chief lnspector,

124
00:13:35,398 --> 00:13:38,485
I've known Eddie a long time,
and he's a good cop.

125
00:13:38,526 --> 00:13:40,737
Whatever kind of cop
Walenski once was...

126
00:13:40,737 --> 00:13:42,697
he let drift a long time ago.

127
00:13:42,739 --> 00:13:44,532
Let me talk to Bumstead!

128
00:13:44,574 --> 00:13:46,618
Come on! Hold on!

129
00:13:47,285 --> 00:13:48,453
Frank!

130
00:13:51,539 --> 00:13:53,583
-Get his arm !
-They're watching us!

131
00:13:53,625 --> 00:13:55,877
-On your feet!
-There's no way out!

132
00:13:57,295 --> 00:13:59,005
God, can't you see?

133
00:14:02,425 --> 00:14:04,761
Let me go!
I'm not going to hurt you.

134
00:14:06,304 --> 00:14:08,515
-What was that?
-Walenski.

135
00:14:16,898 --> 00:14:20,068
I'm being punished
for my sins, right?

136
00:14:20,068 --> 00:14:24,406
What did I ever do to inherit
this? Where do you begin?

137
00:14:24,406 --> 00:14:27,409
Well, everything Detective
Walenski committed to paper...

138
00:14:27,409 --> 00:14:28,827
should be here, so--

139
00:14:28,910 --> 00:14:31,454
The only thing that should be
committed is Walenski.

140
00:14:33,748 --> 00:14:35,625
Nothing like
a little healthy paranoia.

141
00:14:42,215 --> 00:14:45,552
I came here to file a missing
persons report for my husband.

142
00:14:45,593 --> 00:14:48,972
-Take it to the front desk.
-They told me to come see you.

143
00:14:51,266 --> 00:14:52,934
His name's John Murdoch.

144
00:14:55,979 --> 00:14:59,357
Do these names mean
anything to you?

145
00:15:00,191 --> 00:15:02,152
Who are these women?

146
00:15:02,193 --> 00:15:04,070
Why are you looking
for my husband?

147
00:15:04,112 --> 00:15:06,364
Are you going to accuse him
of something?

148
00:15:06,406 --> 00:15:09,951
-Maybe. Maybe murder.
-Whose murder?

149
00:15:11,369 --> 00:15:14,622
-Which one?
-All of them.

150
00:15:16,041 --> 00:15:19,336
Mrs. Murdoch, I am sorry.
I didn't mean to alarm you.

151
00:15:19,377 --> 00:15:22,130
I'm sorry that I came.
I just made a mistake.

152
00:15:22,172 --> 00:15:25,967
If you'd please just give me
half a second to explain.

153
00:15:35,310 --> 00:15:36,561
We met before?

154
00:15:38,229 --> 00:15:41,316
If we did,
I hope you're still breathing.

155
00:15:41,358 --> 00:15:42,901
What's your name, honey?

156
00:15:46,696 --> 00:15:48,490
Well, that's
an appropriate name.

157
00:15:56,414 --> 00:15:57,707
I was just thinking.

158
00:16:01,920 --> 00:16:03,505
What you do...

159
00:16:04,714 --> 00:16:09,761
It seems kind of dangerous...
right now.

160
00:16:09,803 --> 00:16:11,763
How do you know
I'm not the killer?

161
00:16:11,763 --> 00:16:15,016
You don't seem like
the killer type. Why?

162
00:16:15,975 --> 00:16:18,186
You feeling any urges
I should know about?

163
00:16:30,281 --> 00:16:31,449
Shoot.

164
00:17:19,122 --> 00:17:22,959
So it seems you've discovered
your unpleasant nature.

165
00:17:23,001 --> 00:17:26,796
-Who are you?
-We might ask the same question.

166
00:17:27,797 --> 00:17:30,050
Sleep...now.

167
00:17:55,575 --> 00:17:56,826
He can Tune!

168
00:18:49,963 --> 00:18:53,133
What is to be done?
This man is dangerous.

169
00:18:53,174 --> 00:18:56,302
-It is said he is able to Tune.
-Impossible!

170
00:18:56,344 --> 00:18:59,389
We have seen it
with our own eyes.

171
00:18:59,431 --> 00:19:02,267
On occasion, the imprinting
does not take.

172
00:19:02,308 --> 00:19:04,894
They behave erratically
when they awaken.

173
00:19:04,894 --> 00:19:08,565
We find them wandering
like lost children.

174
00:19:08,606 --> 00:19:10,734
But this one was different, yes?

175
00:19:10,775 --> 00:19:14,571
-What has the doctor to say?
-He has failed to report in.

176
00:19:14,612 --> 00:19:17,741
-And Mr. Quick?
-No more Mr. Quick.

177
00:19:17,782 --> 00:19:20,410
Mr. Quick...dead, yes.

178
00:19:23,788 --> 00:19:26,416
Poor, poor Mr. Quick.

179
00:19:26,458 --> 00:19:29,336
Mr. Book...does he know?

180
00:19:30,337 --> 00:19:32,422
Should we not know, Mr. Hand?

181
00:19:33,465 --> 00:19:36,343
We had hoped to learn more
before sharing with you.

182
00:19:36,343 --> 00:19:39,346
We can know nothing
until we possess him.

183
00:19:39,346 --> 00:19:41,598
We must have this man.

184
00:19:47,562 --> 00:19:48,730
My brand, I hope.

185
00:20:01,034 --> 00:20:02,619
I've been worried about you.

186
00:20:06,664 --> 00:20:07,999
Are you punishing me?

187
00:20:08,750 --> 00:20:11,378
If disappearing is
your way of punishing me,

188
00:20:11,419 --> 00:20:12,671
I don't appreciate it.

189
00:20:12,671 --> 00:20:13,838
What are you talking about?

190
00:20:17,342 --> 00:20:21,179
I found these keys in my pocket,
so I assume I live here.

191
00:20:23,348 --> 00:20:25,684
-You supposed to be my wife?
-"Supposed to be"?

192
00:20:29,229 --> 00:20:33,233
You really...don't know
who I am, do you.

193
00:20:34,067 --> 00:20:36,903
Your doctor called me. He was
worried that this might happen.

194
00:20:36,903 --> 00:20:38,196
My doctor?

195
00:20:41,074 --> 00:20:44,828
He gave me his card.
He's desperate to find you.

196
00:20:52,585 --> 00:20:54,587
Feel like I'm living out
someone else's nightmare.

197
00:20:54,629 --> 00:20:57,424
What happened to me?
Why was I seeing a doctor?

198
00:20:58,008 --> 00:20:59,509
I had an affair.

199
00:21:01,428 --> 00:21:02,762
You were angry at me.

200
00:21:05,932 --> 00:21:09,602
Closing time.
The pool is now closed.

201
00:21:19,320 --> 00:21:21,656
Most unfortunate it is...

202
00:21:21,740 --> 00:21:23,992
that we were forced
to seek you out here.

203
00:21:24,951 --> 00:21:29,122
You know how uncomfortable
we find all this moisture.

204
00:21:29,998 --> 00:21:33,293
-I'm sorry. I--
-Failed to report in, yes?

205
00:21:33,335 --> 00:21:36,296
I was frightened.
I have a weak heart, you know.

206
00:21:36,296 --> 00:21:39,841
Your weakness is not, we think,
an affair of the heart.

207
00:21:39,924 --> 00:21:42,594
We found this in his hotel room.

208
00:21:42,635 --> 00:21:46,139
Must we reproduce
Mr. Murdoch's memories again?

209
00:21:46,139 --> 00:21:48,308
I tried to reprint him,
but he woke up.

210
00:21:48,350 --> 00:21:50,518
He knocked the syringe
right out of my hand.

211
00:21:50,602 --> 00:21:53,813
-He has no memories, then?
-Only fragments.

212
00:21:53,813 --> 00:21:55,357
The procedure,
it was interrupted.

213
00:21:55,357 --> 00:21:58,109
I guess it's only a matter
of rounding him up.

214
00:21:58,860 --> 00:22:00,528
You have had strays
before, right?

215
00:22:00,612 --> 00:22:04,491
This is no stray, Doctor.
This one can Tune.

216
00:22:04,491 --> 00:22:07,577
But that's impossible.
Only you have that ability.

217
00:22:07,619 --> 00:22:09,913
You will process
another template...

218
00:22:09,954 --> 00:22:11,998
of the subject's memories, yes?

219
00:22:12,040 --> 00:22:13,625
Of course.
I'll imprint him again.

220
00:22:15,210 --> 00:22:18,463
We require them
for a quite different purpose.

221
00:22:18,505 --> 00:22:21,299
It's almost midnight,
Dr. Schreber.

222
00:22:21,341 --> 00:22:23,176
We'll talk again
after tonight's Tuning,

223
00:22:23,218 --> 00:22:26,137
but no more delays, yes?

224
00:22:26,179 --> 00:22:31,017
No more inconsistencies
in your behavior.

225
00:22:32,852 --> 00:22:34,521
The police were looking for you.

226
00:22:34,521 --> 00:22:36,690
I know. I saw the papers.

227
00:22:36,731 --> 00:22:39,192
"Killer stalks
city street-walkers."

228
00:22:42,821 --> 00:22:45,156
I was with one of those women.

229
00:22:46,700 --> 00:22:50,078
-Before I came here tonight.
-I don't understand.

230
00:22:50,161 --> 00:22:55,041
I met her outside an Automat.
I guess I wanted to test myself.

231
00:22:56,751 --> 00:23:00,213
I wanted to know if I had it
in me to do those things.

232
00:23:00,213 --> 00:23:01,715
Maybe I have lost my mind,

233
00:23:01,756 --> 00:23:04,759
but whoever I am, I'm still me,
and I'm not a killer.

234
00:23:10,765 --> 00:23:12,100
I believe you.

235
00:23:13,977 --> 00:23:15,186
You do?

236
00:23:19,733 --> 00:23:21,735
-What?
-The car outside.

237
00:23:21,776 --> 00:23:23,236
The one you arrived in.

238
00:23:23,278 --> 00:23:25,572
It's a cop.
He dropped me off here.

239
00:23:27,741 --> 00:23:29,492
I didn't know he was still here.

240
00:23:33,079 --> 00:23:34,539
Hold it right there, mister!

241
00:23:36,958 --> 00:23:39,961
-Wait. You have the wrong man.
-Stand aside, will you, please?

242
00:23:40,003 --> 00:23:41,463
I didn't kill anyone.

243
00:23:41,504 --> 00:23:43,798
Right now,
all you are is a suspect.

244
00:23:43,840 --> 00:23:47,093
Turn yourself in. I'll listen
to whatever you have to say.

245
00:23:47,093 --> 00:23:49,179
You won't believe
what I have to say.

246
00:23:50,305 --> 00:23:53,600
-Try me.
-There's someone after me.

247
00:23:53,600 --> 00:23:57,312
It's this group of men.
They want me dead.

248
00:23:57,312 --> 00:24:00,148
And I don't even know if...
they're not even--

249
00:24:00,190 --> 00:24:02,442
Yeah, who's going to listen
to a madman?

250
00:24:02,484 --> 00:24:04,986
-Stand aside, Mrs. Murdoch.
-Run!

251
00:24:09,324 --> 00:24:11,284
No one ever listens to me.

252
00:24:17,540 --> 00:24:18,625
Murdoch, stop!

253
00:25:01,501 --> 00:25:03,837
-How much further?
-We're almost there, buddy.

254
00:25:07,382 --> 00:25:09,718
You happen to know
the way to Shell Beach?

255
00:25:09,759 --> 00:25:12,846
You're kidding! Me and the wife
spent our honeymoon there.

256
00:25:12,887 --> 00:25:15,390
All you do is
take Main Street West to...

257
00:25:18,393 --> 00:25:21,604
Or is it the Cross...
Now, that's funny.

258
00:25:21,688 --> 00:25:24,774
I can't seem to remember
if it's Main Street West...

259
00:25:24,858 --> 00:25:26,109
or the Crosstown.

260
00:25:30,780 --> 00:25:33,867
I'm sorry, lnspector,
I cannot be of more assistance,

261
00:25:33,950 --> 00:25:35,910
but I am running late
for an appointment.

262
00:25:35,952 --> 00:25:38,079
Well, I appreciate you
taking the time.

263
00:25:46,796 --> 00:25:49,215
There's just one thing
that puzzles me.

264
00:25:49,257 --> 00:25:53,803
I've met quite a few murderers
in the course of my work.

265
00:25:53,845 --> 00:25:56,556
Murdoch doesn't
strike me as one.

266
00:25:56,598 --> 00:25:59,768
Perhaps you are not accustomed
to digging deep enough.

267
00:25:59,809 --> 00:26:02,687
Well, I do know when
someone is lying to me, Doctor.

268
00:26:02,729 --> 00:26:06,941
Inspector, judging personalities
happens to be my business.

269
00:26:06,941 --> 00:26:08,943
Maybe you can give me
a few pointers.

270
00:26:08,985 --> 00:26:12,947
Certainly.
Let's take you, for instance.

271
00:26:12,989 --> 00:26:16,117
You are a fastidious man.
Driven.

272
00:26:16,159 --> 00:26:18,453
Consumed by details.

273
00:26:18,495 --> 00:26:21,998
I would say
your life is rather lonely.

274
00:26:21,998 --> 00:26:24,626
Good evening, lnspector.
I really must be going.

275
00:27:02,372 --> 00:27:03,456
Come in.

276
00:27:08,461 --> 00:27:10,255
-How is he?
-The same.

277
00:27:11,548 --> 00:27:14,175
Walenski? It's me, Frank.

278
00:27:20,557 --> 00:27:21,766
Come in, Frank.

279
00:27:25,020 --> 00:27:26,229
Close the door.

280
00:27:34,279 --> 00:27:37,574
I've been looking through
some of your old reports.

281
00:27:37,615 --> 00:27:39,743
It's an interesting case.

282
00:27:40,869 --> 00:27:44,080
Kind that make a man's career.

283
00:27:45,790 --> 00:27:49,419
-Or break it.
-Yeah. I was on that case.

284
00:27:49,461 --> 00:27:53,298
And then what?
What happened then, Eddie?

285
00:27:53,298 --> 00:27:54,758
Nothing happened, Frank.

286
00:27:55,800 --> 00:27:57,802
I've just been spending time
in the subway,

287
00:27:57,844 --> 00:27:59,763
riding in circles.

288
00:27:59,804 --> 00:28:03,350
Thinking in circles.
There's no way out.

289
00:28:05,602 --> 00:28:07,270
I've been over this entire city.

290
00:28:11,775 --> 00:28:13,651
You're scaring your wife
to death, Eddie.

291
00:28:13,693 --> 00:28:15,195
She's not my wife.

292
00:28:17,030 --> 00:28:19,991
I don't know who she is
or who any of us are.

293
00:28:20,033 --> 00:28:23,411
-What makes you say that?
-You think about the past much?

294
00:28:25,455 --> 00:28:26,956
As much as the next guy.

295
00:28:27,957 --> 00:28:30,710
See, I've been trying
to remember things--

296
00:28:30,794 --> 00:28:33,838
clearly remember things
from my past.

297
00:28:33,880 --> 00:28:36,049
But the more
I try to think back,

298
00:28:36,132 --> 00:28:39,135
the more it all starts
to unravel.

299
00:28:39,135 --> 00:28:40,345
None of it seems real.

300
00:28:40,345 --> 00:28:44,516
It's like I've just
been dreaming this life,

301
00:28:44,516 --> 00:28:47,477
and when I finally wake up,
I'll be somebody else,

302
00:28:47,477 --> 00:28:49,479
somebody totally different.

303
00:28:53,858 --> 00:28:56,027
You saw something,
didn't you, Eddie.

304
00:28:57,195 --> 00:28:59,698
Something to do with the case.

305
00:29:00,323 --> 00:29:03,702
There is no case!
There never was!

306
00:29:03,702 --> 00:29:07,664
It's all just a big joke!
It's a joke!

307
00:29:48,705 --> 00:29:50,457
Tonight's requirements are...

308
00:29:50,540 --> 00:29:53,752
12 family photo albums,

309
00:29:53,793 --> 00:29:56,254
nine personal diaries,

310
00:29:56,254 --> 00:29:58,423
17 love letters,

311
00:29:58,423 --> 00:30:00,884
assorted childhood photographs,

312
00:30:00,925 --> 00:30:05,096
requisite false l.D.s
and social security cards.

313
00:30:05,138 --> 00:30:07,432
These do bring back memories.

314
00:30:09,768 --> 00:30:12,062
This one is still warm.

315
00:30:12,812 --> 00:30:13,980
What is it?

316
00:30:13,980 --> 00:30:17,233
The recollections of
a great lover?

317
00:30:17,275 --> 00:30:19,569
A catalogue of conquests?

318
00:30:20,278 --> 00:30:21,780
We will soon find out.

319
00:30:23,073 --> 00:30:24,574
You wouldn't
appreciate that,

320
00:30:24,616 --> 00:30:27,827
would you,
Mr. Whatever-your-name is?

321
00:30:27,869 --> 00:30:32,165
Not the sort of conquest
you would ever understand.

322
00:30:32,957 --> 00:30:34,250
Let's see.

323
00:30:35,543 --> 00:30:38,254
A touch of
unhappy childhood...

324
00:30:43,927 --> 00:30:46,513
A dash of
teenage rebellion...

325
00:30:48,098 --> 00:30:51,142
And last but not least...

326
00:30:51,184 --> 00:30:53,770
a tragic death
in the family.

327
00:30:56,606 --> 00:30:58,274
Mr. Book.

328
00:31:05,323 --> 00:31:08,868
Why does Murdoch not sleep
during the Tuning?

329
00:31:08,952 --> 00:31:13,164
Maybe he's a step up
the evolutionary ladder.

330
00:31:13,206 --> 00:31:14,457
A freak of nature.

331
00:31:14,499 --> 00:31:17,335
He's adapting to survive.
What do you expect?

332
00:31:17,377 --> 00:31:19,295
Weren't you looking for
the human soul?

333
00:31:19,337 --> 00:31:21,965
Isn't that the purpose
of your little zoo?

334
00:31:22,007 --> 00:31:25,343
That's why you change people
and things every night.

335
00:31:25,385 --> 00:31:28,221
Maybe you have finally
found what you are looking for,

336
00:31:28,304 --> 00:31:29,848
and it's going to bite you
on your--

337
00:31:33,893 --> 00:31:35,812
It requires several
of your lifetimes...

338
00:31:35,854 --> 00:31:37,522
to master our gifts.

339
00:31:37,564 --> 00:31:39,357
The idea that
a simple man...

340
00:31:39,399 --> 00:31:41,401
could develop the ability
to Tune is--

341
00:31:41,443 --> 00:31:42,569
Absurd, I know.

342
00:31:42,610 --> 00:31:44,904
What other explanation is there?

343
00:31:49,868 --> 00:31:51,036
It is time.

344
00:32:36,998 --> 00:32:38,458
Shut it down.

345
00:32:56,935 --> 00:33:00,063
Fredrickson says he'll take me
off the night shift.

346
00:33:00,105 --> 00:33:01,940
It's about time, dear.

347
00:33:52,741 --> 00:33:53,742
Hello?

348
00:34:02,042 --> 00:34:03,376
Wake up.

349
00:34:06,504 --> 00:34:08,006
Wake up!

350
00:34:18,058 --> 00:34:20,226
Can anyone hear me?

351
00:34:23,396 --> 00:34:26,232
Let the Tuning commence.

352
00:37:06,101 --> 00:37:07,435
The Goodwins.

353
00:37:07,477 --> 00:37:09,479
Charlie, Sylvia,

354
00:37:09,562 --> 00:37:11,648
Jane, and little Matthew.

355
00:37:15,485 --> 00:37:17,737
Jane and little Matthew.

356
00:37:47,892 --> 00:37:50,145
The rich get richer.

357
00:37:50,186 --> 00:37:52,272
Probably have
maid's quarters...

358
00:37:52,355 --> 00:37:53,690
before the night
is through.

359
00:38:47,285 --> 00:38:49,245
Dr. Schreber, I presume.

360
00:38:49,287 --> 00:38:50,789
It's you.

361
00:38:50,830 --> 00:38:51,873
Hey, come on.

362
00:38:51,915 --> 00:38:54,042
That's no way to greet
a patient, Doctor,

363
00:38:54,084 --> 00:38:56,211
if that's what you are.

364
00:38:56,252 --> 00:38:57,671
Please, l--

365
00:38:57,712 --> 00:38:59,547
Why is everyone asleep?

366
00:38:59,589 --> 00:39:01,966
Please keep your voice down.

367
00:39:02,008 --> 00:39:03,927
I can't remember anything.
What have you done?

368
00:39:03,968 --> 00:39:06,763
Nothing. I want to help you.

369
00:39:06,805 --> 00:39:10,225
We cannot talk here.
If they see us together--

370
00:39:10,266 --> 00:39:13,144
I don't care.
I want some answers. Now!

371
00:39:13,228 --> 00:39:16,314
Who are they?
Why are they trying to kill me?

372
00:39:16,398 --> 00:39:17,482
Answer me!

373
00:39:22,612 --> 00:39:23,613
My God.

374
00:39:23,655 --> 00:39:26,741
-You really can do it.
-I did that?

375
00:39:26,783 --> 00:39:29,411
Listen to me.
You have their power.

376
00:39:29,452 --> 00:39:31,413
You can make things happen
by will alone.

377
00:39:31,454 --> 00:39:32,997
They call it "Tuning."

378
00:39:33,081 --> 00:39:35,000
That is how they change
the buildings.

379
00:39:35,083 --> 00:39:37,585
Just now you acted
out of self-defense,

380
00:39:37,669 --> 00:39:40,422
but I can teach you
to control your power.

381
00:39:40,463 --> 00:39:44,426
We can stop them.
We can take the city back.

382
00:39:47,762 --> 00:39:49,264
My glasses.

383
00:40:43,526 --> 00:40:45,862
He made a terrible impression
for the firm,

384
00:40:45,904 --> 00:40:48,740
Iollygagging around
as he did.

385
00:40:48,782 --> 00:40:51,618
So I told Fredrickson
I was letting him go.

386
00:40:51,701 --> 00:40:53,703
Well you should have, darling.

387
00:40:54,412 --> 00:40:57,457
He attacked me.
I don't know where he's gone.

388
00:40:57,957 --> 00:41:01,920
Come, Dr. Schreber.
We have much to do.

389
00:41:01,961 --> 00:41:04,547
-Yes?
-Yes.

390
00:41:06,966 --> 00:41:13,390
They say that
you're a runaround lover

391
00:41:14,474 --> 00:41:22,524
Though you say it isn't so

392
00:41:25,402 --> 00:41:32,242
But if you put me down
for another

393
00:41:33,910 --> 00:41:39,749
I'll know, believe me, I'll know

394
00:41:41,251 --> 00:41:44,754
Tonight's experiment will
take place in these locations.

395
00:41:44,796 --> 00:41:48,800
The first subject
shall be imprinted on Avenue M.

396
00:41:48,842 --> 00:41:51,845
Mr. Book, there is a problem.

397
00:41:51,928 --> 00:41:53,471
There is no Avenue M.

398
00:41:53,513 --> 00:41:55,432
We were unable
to complete it.

399
00:41:55,473 --> 00:41:58,935
During the last Tuning,
we detected a lack of control.

400
00:41:58,977 --> 00:42:02,188
An opposing influence
on the machines?

401
00:42:02,272 --> 00:42:06,484
This man Murdoch is
more powerful than we thought.

402
00:42:06,526 --> 00:42:08,486
He is becoming like us.

403
00:42:08,486 --> 00:42:11,948
So we must become like him.

404
00:42:12,866 --> 00:42:15,201
The doctor has done as we asked?

405
00:42:15,243 --> 00:42:18,955
The life and times
of John Murdoch, volume two.

406
00:42:20,957 --> 00:42:23,543
We must not do this.

407
00:42:23,585 --> 00:42:26,963
Murdoch does not possess
these memories, yes?

408
00:42:27,005 --> 00:42:29,841
How will his imprint
allow us to find him?

409
00:42:29,883 --> 00:42:33,303
Everywhere he goes,
everyone he seeks out...

410
00:42:33,345 --> 00:42:34,596
will be known to us.

411
00:42:34,637 --> 00:42:39,768
And as he follows the clues,
so shall we follow the memories.

412
00:42:39,851 --> 00:42:42,228
But to imprint one of us?

413
00:42:42,270 --> 00:42:45,023
Failure has always resulted.

414
00:42:45,023 --> 00:42:48,568
What Mr. Hand proposes
is our only option.

415
00:42:48,610 --> 00:42:50,236
Imprint.

416
00:42:55,700 --> 00:42:57,577
This may sting a bit.

417
00:43:34,072 --> 00:43:35,782
Is it done?

418
00:43:35,824 --> 00:43:38,243
Oh, yes, Mr. Book.

419
00:43:38,284 --> 00:43:42,122
I have John Murdoch in mind.

420
00:43:42,789 --> 00:43:44,374
"Johnny...

421
00:43:44,416 --> 00:43:48,420
"Found this postcard
among your mother's things.

422
00:43:48,461 --> 00:43:50,755
"Brings back memories,
doesn't it?

423
00:43:50,755 --> 00:43:52,590
"Stop by sometime.

424
00:43:52,632 --> 00:43:55,927
"We'll see if we can't
hook ourselves another mermaid.

425
00:43:55,969 --> 00:43:58,263
"Love to Emma. Karl."

426
00:44:03,810 --> 00:44:04,769
Karl.

427
00:44:06,646 --> 00:44:08,314
Karl Harris.

428
00:44:16,489 --> 00:44:17,532
Harris.

429
00:44:25,832 --> 00:44:28,877
Excuse me.
Which way is Avenue C?

430
00:44:28,877 --> 00:44:30,170
Try the subway.

431
00:44:33,882 --> 00:44:35,383
You got a problem, pal?

432
00:44:35,425 --> 00:44:38,261
Been working here long?

433
00:44:38,303 --> 00:44:41,639
25 years.
No days off for good behavior.

434
00:45:06,748 --> 00:45:09,668
We're looking for John Murdoch.

435
00:45:43,952 --> 00:45:46,037
She knows nothing,
Mr. Hand.

436
00:45:46,079 --> 00:45:47,914
A dead end, Mr. Wall.

437
00:45:47,956 --> 00:45:50,709
We thought his imprint
would let us track him.

438
00:45:50,750 --> 00:45:53,253
But instead
we have been brought here.

439
00:45:53,294 --> 00:45:57,340
-This is irrational.
-Instincts are irrational.

440
00:45:57,382 --> 00:46:00,677
We must follow
where they lead, yes?

441
00:46:00,719 --> 00:46:03,972
Mr. Sleep suggests he may go
to places familiar.

442
00:46:04,014 --> 00:46:05,348
His job.

443
00:46:05,390 --> 00:46:07,434
He does not care about our job.

444
00:46:07,434 --> 00:46:10,270
Indulge us, Mr. Hand.

445
00:46:10,311 --> 00:46:12,981
If you were Murdoch, yes?

446
00:46:13,023 --> 00:46:16,359
If I were Murdoch...

447
00:46:18,153 --> 00:46:21,656
I would remember how
my wife had hurt me...

448
00:46:21,698 --> 00:46:23,783
by sleeping with another man.

449
00:46:25,326 --> 00:46:26,828
And then...

450
00:46:28,705 --> 00:46:32,167
I would look for a way
to hurt her in return.

451
00:46:35,170 --> 00:46:39,716
Leave me alone with her.
There's work to be done.

452
00:46:43,386 --> 00:46:45,513
All change,
platform three.

453
00:46:48,224 --> 00:46:49,309
All change?

454
00:46:49,351 --> 00:46:51,686
Excuse me, how do I get
to the end of the line?

455
00:46:51,686 --> 00:46:53,188
You want the Express.

456
00:47:05,742 --> 00:47:08,203
How come the train didn't stop?

457
00:47:08,244 --> 00:47:09,537
That's the Express.

458
00:47:11,081 --> 00:47:12,999
There's no way out.

459
00:47:13,041 --> 00:47:15,835
You can't get out of the city.
I've tried.

460
00:47:16,961 --> 00:47:19,047
You're Murdoch, aren't you?

461
00:47:19,089 --> 00:47:20,757
The one
they've been looking for.

462
00:47:20,799 --> 00:47:21,925
You're not a killer.

463
00:47:22,008 --> 00:47:24,678
They set you up with
a fake identity,

464
00:47:24,719 --> 00:47:26,346
Iike everyone else here.

465
00:47:26,388 --> 00:47:28,348
-Who are you?
-I was a cop.

466
00:47:28,348 --> 00:47:31,518
At least in this life I was.

467
00:47:31,518 --> 00:47:34,354
They steal peoples' memories.

468
00:47:34,396 --> 00:47:36,231
Then they swap them around
between us.

469
00:47:36,231 --> 00:47:38,942
I seen them do it,
back and forth...

470
00:47:39,025 --> 00:47:41,111
till no one knows
who they are anymore.

471
00:47:41,194 --> 00:47:42,445
How do you know all this?

472
00:47:42,529 --> 00:47:44,280
Once in a while one of us
wakes up...

473
00:47:44,364 --> 00:47:45,740
while they're changing things.

474
00:47:46,700 --> 00:47:49,202
It's not supposed to happen,
but it does.

475
00:47:49,244 --> 00:47:50,578
It happened to me.

476
00:47:51,246 --> 00:47:53,123
They'll come looking for you.

477
00:47:54,290 --> 00:47:56,626
Just like they'll come
looking for me.

478
00:47:56,626 --> 00:47:58,086
But that's OK.

479
00:47:58,086 --> 00:47:59,295
I figured a way out.

480
00:48:10,765 --> 00:48:12,017
They were here.

481
00:48:14,102 --> 00:48:15,520
Last night.

482
00:48:15,562 --> 00:48:17,772
This was to be his home.

483
00:48:20,442 --> 00:48:22,235
That was when we loved her.

484
00:48:22,277 --> 00:48:24,612
This is all well and good,

485
00:48:24,654 --> 00:48:26,656
but we require
a more practical link...

486
00:48:26,698 --> 00:48:28,742
to his present whereabouts.

487
00:48:33,371 --> 00:48:35,457
And I know where to find her.

488
00:48:43,840 --> 00:48:47,177
We're very lucky,
when you think about it.

489
00:48:47,177 --> 00:48:48,219
I'm sorry?

490
00:48:48,303 --> 00:48:50,347
To be able to revisit
those places...

491
00:48:50,347 --> 00:48:52,349
which meant
so very much to us.

492
00:48:53,183 --> 00:48:55,727
I thought we were haunted
by them.

493
00:48:55,810 --> 00:48:57,520
Perhaps.

494
00:48:57,520 --> 00:49:00,023
There used to be a ferry
when I was a boy.

495
00:49:00,023 --> 00:49:02,150
Biggest thing you ever saw.

496
00:49:02,192 --> 00:49:05,028
Lit up like
a floating birthday cake.

497
00:49:06,404 --> 00:49:08,948
That's just what my husband
once said to me.

498
00:49:08,990 --> 00:49:10,533
On this very spot.

499
00:49:12,035 --> 00:49:14,120
Where is your husband now?

500
00:49:14,162 --> 00:49:17,999
I wish I knew.
What brings you here?

501
00:49:17,999 --> 00:49:20,877
I met my wife at this place.

502
00:49:20,919 --> 00:49:23,171
It's where I met my husband.

503
00:49:23,213 --> 00:49:24,714
Small world.

504
00:50:18,893 --> 00:50:19,894
Hello?

505
00:51:07,233 --> 00:51:09,110
What are you doing here?

506
00:51:09,110 --> 00:51:10,779
I've been following you.
